pullRequest.title: [ISSUE #2044] Fix DefaultLitePullConsumerImpl NPE

nodes.bodyText: assignedMessageQueue.getProcessQueue(messageQueue) may return null. So it is necessary to check if processQueue is null to prevent NPE
why not just write as if (processQueue == null || processQueue.isDropped()) ? This is more concise
powermock provide mock private method. you could use it to test null case and dropped case separately
